Vladimir Bossicard wrote:

> > I need to write a test case where I need to spun off different
> > threads to test one of my classes to test the thread safety of that
> > class.  I was wondering how do I do that using junit.
>
> http://www.javaworld.com/javaworld/jw-12-2000/jw-1221-junit.html
>

The JUnitPerf LoadTest uses a technique similar to that demonstrated in this
article.  One difference is that you can decorate any existing JUnit test
with a LoadTest, rather than having to create a specific subclass for
multi-threaded testing.  In other words, it favors composition over
inheritance.
